title: As a blogger, how do I know whether I am writing for the right audience or not? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s simple. You just spend a few minutes on the keyword research. To do so, you can follow my way: Just choose the product or service, let’s say data science or birth certificate or web services, to start with.Put it into the Google search bar.A series of phrases will appear. These are the most searchable keywords, also known as niche topics.Pick up the one that you feel comfortable to write on.You can find more LSIs, to make sub-titles, which again have high searches.Keep into account that high searches define a domain. It is where your target audience look into for more and more information.

If you are blogging for interest, then you only need to worry about the content and sense of style. Don’t bother about the right audience. The right audience will follow. Just ensure you are packaging the content well and marketing it properly, which is what matters.
One of the way to find out is through the web traffic. Secondly, you can invite your readers to comment on your post. Shares can also help you to some extent.
